intro: Endlicheria acuminata, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are typically palmately lobed and have a rough texture. Endlicheria acuminata thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in cloud forests.
